item.title: 1 Body: The first step for a seeker
item.description: < Previous | Contents | Next > ‌CHAPTER 1 Body: The first step for a seeker 3 February 1968 am in Ajol Meditation Camp [Note: This is the final edit of the Hindi translation of Antar Yatra, later published as part of Sadhana Path. This is for reference use only, pending publication.] My Beloved Ones, In this first meeting of the meditation camp, I would like to talk about the first step for a meditator, a seeker.

item.title: 2 From the Head to the Heart, from the Heart to the Navel
item.description: < Previous | Contents | Next > ‌CHAPTER 2 From the Head to the Heart, from the Heart to the Navel 3 February 1968 om in Ajol Meditation Camp [Note: This is the final edit of the Hindi translation of Antar Yatra, later published as part of Sadhana Path. This is for reference use only, pending publication.] My Beloved Ones, This afternoon I would like to discuss a few more points relating to the real center of the body.

item.title: 3 The journey towards the navel: Right diet \-- labour \-- sleep
item.description: < Previous | Contents | Next > ‌CHAPTER 3 The journey towards the navel: Right diet – labour – sleep 3 February 1968 pm in Ajol Meditation Camp [Note: This is the final edit of the Hindi translation of Antar Yatra, later published as part of Sadhana Path. This is for reference use only, pending publication.] My Beloved Ones, How the life of man can become centered in his being, how he can experience himself, how he can attain his own self, we have discussed in the previous two talks of today.

item.title: 4 The ways to encounter the mind
item.description: < Previous | Contents | Next > ‌CHAPTER 4 The ways to encounter the mind 4 February 1968 am in Ajol Meditation Camp [Note: This is the final edit of the Hindi translation of Antar Yatra, later published as part of Sadhana Path. This is for reference use only, pending publication.] My Beloved Ones, The mind of man, his brain, has become a sick wound. It is no longer a healthy center, it has turned into an unhealthy ulcer.

item.title: 5 Freedom from the illusion of knowledge
item.description: < Previous | Contents | Next > ‌CHAPTER 5 Freedom from the illusion of knowledge 4 February 1968 om in Ajol Meditation Camp [Note: This is the final edit of the Hindi translation of Antar Yatra, later published as part of Sadhana Path. This is for reference use only, pending publication.] My Beloved Ones, The state of man’s mind is like a disturbed hive of honey bees. Thoughts and thoughts and thoughts buzz round and round.

item.title: 6 Freedom from belief
item.description: < Previous | Contents | Next > ‌CHAPTER 6 Freedom from belief 4 February 1968 pm in Ajol Meditation Camp [Note: This is the final edit of the Hindi translation of Antar Yatra, later published as part of Sadhana Path. This is for reference use only, pending publication.] My Beloved Ones, Man is tied up in chains of thoughts like a prisoner. In this prison of thoughts what kinds of stones have been used as a foundation?

item.title: 7 The sutras of the veena of the heart
item.description: < Previous | Contents | Next > ‌CHAPTER 7 The sutras of the veena of the heart 5 February 1968 am in Ajol Meditation Camp [Note: This is the final edit of the Hindi translation of Antar Yatra, later published as part of Sadhana Path. This is for reference use only, pending publication.] My Beloved Ones, The center of thinking is the brain, the center of feeling is the heart, and the center of life-energy is the navel.

item.title: 8 Freedom from the \"I\"
item.description: < Previous | Contents ‌CHAPTER 8 Freedom from the “I” 5 February 1968 pm in Ajol Meditation Camp [Note: This is the final edit of the Hindi translation of Antar Yatra, later published as part of Sadhana Path. This is for reference use only, pending publication.] My Beloved Ones, Tonight is the last meeting of the camp, and in this last meeting I want to talk to you about some last sutras.
